benchmark_details.name: CLR-Bench
benchmark_details.overview: CLR-Bench is a benchmark specifically designed to evaluate the reasoning capabilities of large language models in college-level tasks, focusing on computer science and artificial intelligence, comprised of 1,018 discipline-specific questions across five question types.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To comprehensively evaluate the reasoning ability of large language models in college-level tasks.

data.source: Collected from 16 authoritative college textbooks guided by domain experts and structured according to a hierarchical topic graph.
data.annotation: Expert-guided rationale generation using GPT-4o and manual verification.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the correctness of the answers and the quality of the rationales provided.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores in Q →A indicate better answer predictions; Q →AR assesses both answer correctness and rationale quality.
methodology.validation: Extensive experiments conducted across 40 language models to validate results.
